text: Thomas Johnstone Lawrence (14 May 1940 - 10 January 2018) was a Scottish professional footballer. He played as a goalkeeper. He played for English clubs Liverpool and Tranmere Rovers from the 1950s through to the 1970s. He also played in three times for Scotland during the 1960s. He was a twice league champion and an FA Cup winner with Liverpool. Lawrence was born in Dailly, Ayrshire. He had a son, Stephen. In 2015, Lawrence made news headlines when a BBC journalist asked if he remembered a game between Liverpool and Everton. He replied "I do, I played in it. I was the goalkeeper for Liverpool." Lawrence died on 10 January 2018 in Warrington, Cheshire. He was 77. ==Honours== ;Liverpool *Football League First Division: 1963–64, 1965–66 *FA Cup: 1965 *FA Charity Shield: 1964, 1965 (shared), 1966 ==References== ==Other websites== * Tommy Lawrence at LiverpoolFC.com Category:1940 births Category:2018 deaths Category:British association football goalkeepers Category:Liverpool F.C. players Category:Footballers from Ayrshire
title: Tommy Lawrence
